Also the workers really seemed like they liked being there. My veggie enchiladas were sooo good! I only gave 4 stars because it's not my favorite but a close second

4AnTEGm22iwfMQ7SxwtfUA.text: We went to Joyride for the tacos.  We're had them before and been satisfied.  l don't understand how they got so bad.  My wife ordered three tacos, pork, chicken and fish.  The pork was just a huge glob of fat.  She almost vomited.  The chicken was ok.  The fish taco that was brought was shrimp which she is allergic to.  They brought her another fish taco and the waiter said to my wife you got a free shrimp taco.  I ordered the taco platter and the carne asada was all gristly.  Really not an enjoyable experience.

o3E1KLiPSuGQTsE-bJWDCw.text: Very friendly and inviting environment! Staff was friendly! Tacos were great!  Will definitely be back!

giKNG2FjkXc_AJUnk8-_qw.text: A really fun Mexican restaurant with a great vibe.   Tacos are great, the burritos are a really good size and tasty and how does love Mexican corn!  Very good drinks with a great happy hour on margs and pitchers and the Agua Fresca are there real hallmark if you are into that thing.

photos.caption: Photo of Joyride Taco House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. $5 happy hour margs!

vIDZU0yYY6QIpuG8YJW8hg.text: It's my second time coming here and I love the margaritas... but that's it. The cucumber Serrano Margarita is so good! The tacos on the other hand are really sad. No flavor at all. I didn't like the tacos the first time and thought ok well it's Taco Tuesday maybeeeee the cooks are in a rush, but I've came to realize that it's just how they are made. Which is fine, the ambience of the place is hip and the servers are really nice. Just wish the food was as good. I will be back for a margarita.

Xs4DkX4EGVFmVv_bNA15Sw.text: My friend I go at least once a month to get tacos here.  Yes, it gets busy, but I promise it is worth it.  I love their quesadillas, street corn, and the crispy fish tacos.  Out of the many times we have been here, we have never had a negative experience.

fFf9k1O196XCQ6vH3-wTCA.text: This was a great spot for Taco Tuesday! The tacos are only $2 and I was pretty full off of two. I tend to always lean towards the seafood ones, they were BOMB. I don't remember the taco selection off the top of my head, but there was plenty of seafood, pork, beef and chicken options for everyone to enjoy.  My husband and his buddy got Margaritas that were only $5 during happy hour. The Lime margarita and the Blood Orange ones were delicious and they went for round 2. So free chips and salsa + $5 Margaritas + $2 Tacos? Pshhh, why not.   All in all, I would go here again.

WhCPcfA1689h5gOZUiVjTw.text: Let's go on a Joyride! There was a time that I tried to get on this ride for dinner, but there was an hour wait! I thought, "Seriously? Is this ride worth it?"  I came for lunch the other day and luckily, there was no wait (a big sigh of relief). The restaurant was so freaken cute! We were given complimentary chips - and the chips weren't too bad. I am a little picky on the types of chips I get at restaurants.   The guacamole had sea salt on it - my preference is that they can do without it. You can order three tacos, and get a free side. However, I opted to get two tacos only - the shrimp and the carne asada tacos. They were yummy.   Now I can see why this "ride" is a "joyride" - great trendy atmosphere, ambiance, vibe, and good food.  I would definitely ride this ride again!

mMBBKCAnFFOMYrJPtUNBVg.text: Love!!!!! Amazing spot for Taco Tuesday. Tried a chicken and carne taco and both were delicious and only $2!!!!! Also had some Mexican corn and was wowed! That ish was bomb!  Long wait at joyride but try to find a seat at the bar and avoid the hour wait!

D6qp7MkvlLKugVE-oQ0wxg.text: Joyride has been one of my favorite spots, but over the last year has went down hill.  Food is still great but the service and attitude is terrible.  In three recent visits we've had to remind our waitperson that we ordered drinks, had to reorder food because the waiter didn't place the order, had wrong orders and the wait people are only pleasant and attentive when they bring the bill. Most of the original wait staff is gone and it seems like there is a new crew on each visit.  It's very sad as joyride use to be our go to place for fun, food and drink.

LwG4IpOINe4opGHU1OxEnQ.text: Come for Taco Tuesday's for $2 tacos because $4.50 tiny tacos are hella not worth it.  $4.50 for a small taco? Even if it's shrimp, I don't care. You gave me 3 small pieces of shrimp. $4.50?????? Laughing out loud. Had to type it out.  On the up side, their Mojito was very yummy & refreshing. My friends all had margaritas & they loved the cucumber one! Try those out!  Their churro dessert was also delicious!  Verdict: this place is cool. That's that. The staff is very nice. It's cool enough to recommend others to check it out. However, for the prices, it's not necessarily worth it (unless you come for happy hour maybe? Or taco Tuesday's). The food was good, not the best, but again, you're basically paying to sit in a nice & pretty/trendy spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Joyride Taco House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp &amp; crispy fish taco. Get the shrimp!

f0sSbQkz0mGv2R7wwzLzzw.text: I had heard about Joyride from a Local at a recent Yelp event I attended. I'd asked where could I get some pretty good mexican and a decent Margarita and she said I had to come to Joyride so here I was. Visited with 3 others and we opted to wait for our table at the bar. We were immediately greeted with smiles and Chips/Salsa. Of course I started with a Margarita and opted for the Prickly Pear as I'd never had it before. My friends opted for a Prickly Pear as well and the Blood Orange Margarita. I'll start by saying they were pretty strong (YES!) and the flavors were lovely but I did not notice a huge difference in flavor between the prickly pear and blood orange however. Time flew by and we were escorted to our table only to be greeted by our lovely waitress "Kait" please note this is the correct spelling as she did write it down for me. Kait, was lovely for so many reasons. First she has a fantastic demeanor/attitude and was able to not only answer all our questions about the food but also made other suggestions I may not have considered. Like the best melted cheese over my veggie burrito, HELLO, that was THE BEST mind you, officially the best burrito I've ever had, wow. Moving along, she made A LOT of suggestions as well about cool places to visit or eat in the area as I'm new to AZ, how helpful was that? I thought she was fantastic as did our entire group. Among the things we ate which were all absolutely fantastic: Veggie burrito (get it with the cheese sauce on top you'll thank me later), Fish tacos, and a few other tacos I can't remember due to margarita #2 LOL, Carne asada burrito & Quesadillas. I so wanted dessert but unfortunately I ate way too many chips/salsa, 2 margaritas, half quesadillia and almost my entire burrito (they are LARGE). This only means 1 thing of course: A) I will have to go back and check out their desserts and of course ask for Kait. Oh and Tuesdays they have $5 margaritas and $2 tacos! I hear it gets pretty busy. I honestly don't mind paying full price. I loved Joyride's vibe, employees, food, decor, margaritas, etc. Totally going back with friends/family.

photos.caption: Photo of Joyride Taco House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oh Yes! Prickly pear &amp; Blood orange margaritas!
Photo of Joyride Taco House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. THE BEST veggie burrito I&#39;ve ever had. Ask for cheese on top, it&#39;s like Heaven but better.
Photo of Joyride Taco House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos everyday, not just Tuesday!

SAa18PiIVIZFIm2BG83q1g.text: I first heard about this place from a friend who shared the great happy hour deals with me. We visited just recently for a couple of pitchers. $5 for a pitcher of craft beer is an amazing deal! We enjoyed the service and the atmosphere. I can't wait to head back!!

hFyNaksl7dAhemKBYR70hw.text: One of my go-to places.  Friendly service, interesting music, nice big room, good chips and salsa.  Yeah, I'm a fan.

Bu6cDUS-kCBanh7dnc-T0A.text: This place service is awful.The food is spicy with everything, it does not have any food items for diabetes or for heart.Food was  awful

2epXT8ZvDyMWdruDnD3A4A.text: This place is so cute and hip, and the margaritas are so bomb! We tried four different types and they were so good. They have a really good happy hour and really nice servers.

o1UIQWpCo4JOXQ-R4iFRNg.text: Tried this place while on vacation in Phoenix.  Great vibe with the good music and indoor outdoor blending.  Good crowd.  Food is above average but not great.   I could hang out here often.  Recommended.

_iBKff-1AgyCpiAC26jwQw.text: My friend and I tried out this place for dinner tonight. Plenty of onsite parking and cool retro decor! The hostess was super funny and our wait staff were awesome and attentive! We tried the chips & salsa (first basket is free), guacamole was amazing and the elote was super yummy. My roommate and I both agreed that we like the appetizers more than our actual tacos. Though they weren't bad, they weren't mind blowing. I will say that they had tons of toppings which was nice. Wasn't too impressed by the side of rice as well. This seems like a good place for drinks and i really enjoyed the ambiance, not sure if I would come back for tacos.

ehzOstenXNoh8fjpPYvOCw.text: I like joyride as soon as we walk in we were greeted with a smile, music was playing, at the bar I could see basketball was on, outside patio was busy since tonight was a beautiful night. I felt good as soon as I walk in, the atmosphere of the restaurant was great. Very trendy, hip,  fist date, or looking for a date restaurant you won't be disappointed. The margaritas were very delicious, beers and beer glasses were cold. I couldn't wait for the food to come but that's were we ran in to some small speed bumps very little ones though. My tacos were good but the tortillas were cold I think my plate sat in the back for few minutes. The chicken burrito was very plain with no chicken in sight. Pack with very good looking vegetables but no flavor. The other three plates of food according to my family were delicious two of them were tacos and my wife ordered the chilaquiles they smell delicious, presentation was beautiful and she loved the flavor of that chilaquiles. She is very picky of margaritas drinks but she really enjoy the delicious margaritas. Please don't order the orchat drink very sweet and the glasses were packed to rim of ice. The wait staff were very friendly always checking our table to make sure were not thirsty (margaritas keep them coming) awesome job!!!!!

ch7gh9AJuquvl59fCL2Alg.text: AS OF October 2018 and forward: I no longer enjoy coming here in Taco Tuesday for one reason; I'll explain.   There are new bartenders that have taken over and ruined the experience. They're often overwhelmed and rude because of the volume and people, and, they're are improperly making the drinks.   Joyride would benefit by designating an area for waiting customers so we're not scrambling around people sitting at the bar. It's less frustration for everyone.   This has happened on multiple occasions and nothing has improved.

lI6TjUjdDyupFiRDBveyUg.text: We've been here a few times. We love the Mexican street corn. The tacos are good too. Service is hit and miss, and be prepared for it to be loud. Love the outdoor seating.

E6YK-0G7g0w4oHVMIsKEnQ.text: Absolutely woooozers! I was shook by how awesome the prices and quality of food are here. I would recommend grabbing tacos and some margs. Karn made a fire cucumber serrano marg and Gabby hooked up a friend with a spiked horchata. Love this place!

YFs1ZsaIco6S6TS1YKuuOA.text: Pretty good place to get tacos!   Came with a group of four and got sat down immediately for a prime dinner time.  I really like their taco combo and would definitely recommend. Their joyrice wasn't the most worth, in my opinion, but the tacos were wonderful.

6y8JhKRYO3mkflOE4gspcw.text: Went for lunch on a Monday and the service was awful. Took forever to get our order in, the waitresses were in no hurry, almost walking around in a daze instead of bringing water to customers and turning tables. It's a lunch hour, not a happy hour and the crowd was clearly people on a lunch break that needed to get back to the office.  I ordered he chicken burrito, edible sure, but I wouldn't order it again.  It took a full 30 minutes after we were done eating to actually be paid and out the door. Had to ask for the check twice, waitress disappeared after she took it, and we eventually just got up and waited by the bar (we were in a regular dining booth) to finally get our cards handed back to us.  They had free chips and salsa but that was about all I liked about this place.

yxM6o4wfGvSb5gwOIO6q5g.text: This place is a must visit! The atmosphere is captivating- it's like a modern 70's lounge style. Patio with warmers and a fireplace. Decor is super fun and colorful. Each table a candlelight after 5. Food was 5 stars! You can mix and match tacos- I got veggie, chicken, and pork. Super good with unique flavors. We went on a Sunday but great taco Tuesday deals! 3$ tacos and 5$ margaritas. We will defiantly be back.

ieS9pnupZRdxtkzCAuEqsw.text: Fun happy hour place.  Nothing really stands out but nothing is especially bad that I've had!

if_s2kUMM_izUrmFGLgLgw.text: Always love this place: It is not near us but worth the drive. Good service. Great happy hour. Decent prices. Highly recommend.

yZx_XN35TkAXP_eMgMIFtw.text: Joyride is a cool place for tacos  and  and margaritas!!!! $2 tacos, $5 pitchers of beer, and $5 margaritas until 5 pm. Great atmosphere and great fun all around. Will come back for more and you should too! Great food.

74gnL8osO0hwoYaIYd5wrw.text: This place was great. We had a lovely time. The food was delicious. In addition to those reasons to be back, our food order was correct for all four people, the margaritas/beer pitchers were $5 each, our server was magnificent, and we had fast and enthusiastic service.  I recommend to anyone looking for good tacos/cheap beer/great atmosphere for a fun time.

npDqLEp7RbehmG6RiOYbzw.text: Horrible service. 45 minutes for a drink and GM could care less. AVOID! I would go to Taco Bell before this dump.

Yu33jukwbUyEbO8MgS4AkQ.text: 1st time here got in time for their taco happy hour. Must try! The tacos are packed with goodness and half the regular price! Get in before 6pm for it. The atmosphere is also fun and bright and they have a nice patio. Not only did we get tacos but we started the meal with nachos. For the future you may just want to order that as a meal. It is huge and packed to the gill with cheese, veggies and what ever protein you may want.   I happily recommend checking this place out for great ambience and food!

1REJpXxLG8qsJpiYsiVVcg.text: I love Joyride! They have the best taco Tuesdays! Tacos for only $2! They have yummy vegan tacos that I always get and they have awesome $5 margs in Tuesday's as well. A very fun place to get together with friends or co workers. On Tuesdays they get busy so it's best to go before 5 or after 7:30ish.

21xJlCtvJMCMMoEwGAgZmA.text: This place is "ok". The staff and environment is great but the food was nothing special, was hoping for a bit more with how many good reviews this place had. The carne tacos didn't have much flavor and what flavor it did have was more of a charred flavor. Braised beef was ok, I've had better, and the pork really didn't blow me away. Everything was kind of just plopped in a tortilla with an ice cream scoop it seemed. For desert I had the vanilla pudding... which wasn't really pudding at all, seemed more like melted ice cream with some nuts Carmel and a breading thrown in.   This place I feel would do even better with some better food because I would have loved to bring the whole group of friends for a chill dinner but we're all foodies and would be a bit disappointed with the food. So many good taco places around the valley, this is a great location and building but needs some food help.

m-GVwtsj71v446bWW50r1A.text: Very good for the money. I'm used to dropping a dime every time my wife and I go out to Dinner, and this place was very reasonable. I was almost concerned. We tried a few different menu items just to get a few for the menu and everything was very good. I may he butchering the name, but the Pork Taco was great. Nicely seasoned. I was starving and figured, "Go with a Burrito" and it was just right. Not too much, but also plenty of food.   I highly recommend this place. They stay open late on week nights and have something to offer everyone.

pjCdnkZyTCzspEfqddB5Vg.text: I've eaten here for the last 4 years and it feels like the food has gotten mediocre and the staff has gotten slower. They are definitely friendly but very unattentive when it comes to getting your cocktails or guacamole, which came after the dinner. Even on a slow Monday, the service was unacceptable. Our small table has dishes that should have been taken up, so we had to place them on the patio partition to make room. Every cocktail that came was watered down cause of probably sitting there at the bar too long. And most of the tacos have the same boring slaw. There's numerous staff asking you if you need anything but the follow up gets lost in the chaos...and this is on a slow Monday evening! Shame cause it's a great neighborhood space but the predictable flavorless menu and slow staff definitely needs to be revamped. Too many other good street taco places in Phoenix to chose from....

M9qlkPIxJmCoPzQzw71S2g.text: Situated in uptown Phoenix, there aren't that many sit down taco joints so this place will do if ambiance is important to you because the decor and vibe of this establishment is great! The food just tastes fine. My friends seem to love this place so I find myself here often but for the price point and taste, there are better options out there. I sure hope to find something good here soon though. I am hearing good things about the beast burrito so that may be the next thing I eat.

cW4SwA7VGBwb0rJ8LX-xzw.text: I wanted to give this place a huge shout out!   My brother in-law and I threw a surprise 30th birthday for my sister here on February 8th and I couldn't be more thrilled and happy with the service I received.   I wish I could remember the gentleman's name that took care of us, but he was a rock star. We were a large party.. about 20 of us.   He had some helpers who were great as well. They were on top of things and very friendly. They looked like they loved their job and I absolutely adored that quality.   Our margaritas were great. Food was on point and they even helped me light the candles for the cake I had made.   Thank you for making my sisters night special.

PhdKibWizMVQsPzA0rIvaQ.text: Joyride has delicious tacos! I always get the carne asada and crispy fish tacos with chips and salsa. Sometimes, they can be crazy busy so I don't come down too often. Overall though, love the vibe, atmosphere and food.

HWI0qKLW5sFp8ZnniC-tuw.text: This place has pretty great tacos and every time I go they are consistently good. The atmosphere is a fun vibe at night with low lighting and some modern music playing at a decent volume. The only reason it's not five star is because the service was just a little too slow for it being a Monday night that wasn't busy. Also, go on Tuesday for $2 tacos, it's a real steal. Way 2 go joyride, you pretty darn good.

photos.caption: Photo of Joyride Taco House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crispy chicken taco (the best honestly) and the standard (decent)

bFVpXb-0WaZuFuT87JrfoQ.text: I've been coming here for over 3 years and I don't know why I haven't left a review. This place is INCREDIBLE. We always sit at the bar, the chips come out fast and hot, the staff is quick, friendly and always on point. Now you have to come to their happy hour. Everyday $5 until 5pm with $2 tacos. Can you really beat that? NO YOU CANT. I've tried every drink on the menu, yes no shame. EVERY DRINK, THEY ARE ALL DELICIOUS. Prickly pear margarita is my fav. Long story short, joyride you're a goddamn gem. Thank you for making my 3-5s so gooood.

qlqDijIl6J8JkKRl13Q3hQ.text: I went in April and had a bad experience at this restaurant. They overcharged me and I tried getting my money back by going through the manger and the company that manages them called upward projects. There has been no response from them and the service was terrible.

D9pmkNACN9JR9-S-pZEKKQ.text: Really love this place! Their street corn and Mexican slaw sides always get me excited! I usually do the chicken or carne burrito. You can get it in a bowl if you want to skip the tortilla. Last night I ordered thru UberEATS because I had a credit from their driving and it was fast and easy. First time ever using that. I will need to try Yelp Delivery if possible as I just found it today. (If you like Vegan or Gluten free they have those choices marked on the menu)

lOyLwKT-0lMjvHLLtMBSAA.text: Visited JRTH because my kiddo went with a few friends the week before for the first time and they raved about it so we paid a second visit on the Sat after Xmas. Let's start with the good.... Atmosphere-great and lively Service-Taylor the bar keep as I called him was bomb.com. Very personable and was down with my silly humor. Host that greeted and seated was awesome! Waitress- Molly was super sweet On to the food! We ordered a mix of tacos(carne asada, fish tacos, pork, chicken), along with an order of guacamole and elote. Best part of our meal was the salsa/guacamole and chips other then that every single thing came out ice cold including the fish tacos (umm ewww). I was wayyy to tired to wait again for new cold food. My kiddo says she was so disappointed as this was not the same experience she had earlier in the week. I have to say I was too (sad face). Based on that not sure we would drive 30 mins for a repeat. I would say if you plan on going sounds like a weekday would be your best bet! Peace and Eats folks....

t7TILHzo-dGOhrRgwY1_Sw.text: I come here every once in a while when I'm craving a taco. The last couple times though their tacos have been mediocre. I usually order the fried fish taco, veggie taco, and Baja fish taco. The most recent time i came the tacos came out cool and they weren't very flavorful. I do enjoy their margaritas, which are $5 during happy hour. I love the decor that they have here and love their indoor/outdoor seating. The customer service is always great too!

XucUnrP4vO-Jh1fn6eWWEA.text: This place has great food and margaritas, but geez the service is always SOOOO SLOW! Yelp profile shows they take reservations, but when I called they say only for parties of 8 or more. Update your profile!  The last few times I've been in the service has been a lot better. The food is still great. Come check it out!

xovablX9aVcqWznwwaBmtA.text: Joyride absolutely has the best Taco Tuesday hands down.  Food is incredible, service is incredible, ambience is incredible. This is always my go to.   Their taco shells recipe is fluffy and they put them on the grill. Ideal tacos are the carnitas and carne asada but you can't go wrong with any of their tacos. They've switched some margaritas out for new ones and they are very delicious. Try the tropicale and if you like mojitos you'll love be pineapple mojito.

wPeYqgT1daBKFxTcAWp3Cw.text: My wife and I had very high expectations for this taco spot. We drive by it almost everyday weekend and the from the outside it looks like a great place to eat. Unfortunately that's not the experience that we had.   My wife ordered three tacos (asada, carnitas, and adobada) and she received 2 asada and 2 adobada.  The tacos were cold and not what she ordered. We asked the gentlemen who ran the food out to us for a side of salsa and it never came. We would have said something to the bartender but she wasn't very attentive. I don't think she singled us out it was the same for the other people at the bar.   I ordered the Bandit Taco Platter and it was just ok. The beans were good but the rice I couldn't even eat because it had no flavor. The carne asada was in the saltier side. This place is far from authentic.   Unfortunately I wouldn't recommend.   P.S. THEY DONT TAKE DISCOVER. WTH

photos.caption: Photo of Joyride Taco House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beans were good and the tacos were eatable. The rice had zero flavor.

x4FqirRzFtm1ND7OEB2jeA.text: I'm giving Joyride Taco House 5 Stars for many reasons: gorgeous setting, excellent upscale Mexican food, huge full bar, friendly attentive staff, large outdoor patio with with fireplace, bicycle friendly, dog friendly, just a great place to stop by for a drink and appetizer or entertain guests. The food is outstanding! Excellent shrimp tacos. I judge Mexican food by the chips and hot sauce- I knew this would be good! I don't go there often enough but when I do it is a great experience. Highly recommend Joyride Taco House

sWUYjfbXsf_oXwTiqjy5OA.text: Love the happy hour menu and margaritas! The ambiance is wonderful with a nice open feel. You can sit outside year round under their giant shade tree.

fFHD9rH35qv2CI3ezXKv5w.text: Not as great as I expected after hearing great things. Recommendations were just meh. Service was a little slow. Margaritas were way too sweet. Would give a second try just maybe not on a taco Tuesday this time.

XWLAKo-Gp-QpsVbUHan3QQ.text: Love this joint! Tacos and street corn and cucumber mint agua oh my! I live around the way from this spot and even the staff has become a joy to see in house and walking around the area.

-I3jzgrZV_n6cG9zs33BcQ.text: Such a cute place! Love the patio and the margaritas and mojitos were off the charts! Food service was a little slow but the crispy fish tacos are worth coming back for.

photos.caption: Photo of Joyride Taco House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Love the patio!

UxtFMlRnb-s_Xqlnyp5NzQ.text: Great place!  Loved the margarita, the street corn was sooo good I could've ordered five more and the tacos were great.  I only ordered one taco which was great for me because I had an appetizer and desert but def one taco will not fill you up.  All ingredients were obviously super fresh and I loved that we could see in the kitchen so it looked clean.  Cute establishment and environment and interior as well. Loved it!

MthlvHZaZAJ3Hd0UcOt29A.text: Cute little spot for tacos and margaritas. Taco tuesday is a great time to go since tacos are $2. I have a had a great experience every time, and love sitting on the patio. Definitely recommend!

jJN_mJ7jZVpZgBIi7biuaQ.text: Best place i ever been to love the tacos. Great location and environment. Customer service was very excellent.

C8WC1KThh8pG67cjLlrVuQ.text: I'm pretty critical of "taco" places mainly because I'm Mexican but I'm going to be straight up honest with this joint. It's definitely hyped up.   The service: it was ok. They are nice but definitely don't check in as much, it seems like they had 3 servers for the whole place while they were busy. We waited 6 minutes or so just until we were able to ask for more sauce.   The price: One word- overpriced lol. Maybe I'm too Mexican for this but 3.75-4.50 for a taco is a rip off. Only worth it to come during a happy hour special.   The food: the food is pretty good not going to lie. Definitely a twist to what tacos are actually like, but the food tasted good. I ordered the shrimp, crispy fish, & pork adobado as well as a prickly pear margarita. Different but good.

photos.caption: Photo of Joyride Taco House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
